CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The performance of PSCs was insensitive to the ratio of donor to acceptor in range of 1 : 2.5 to 1 : 4. With a weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM is 1 : 3.5 , a PCE of 4.2% with a V oc of 0.96 V , a J sc of 7.6 mA / cm^2 , and an FF of 0.56 was achieved under illumination from an AM 1.5G solar simulator ( 100 mW cm^-2 ). Such high V oc of almost 1 V is consistent with the low - lying HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT. In comparison with the device performance of P1 based PSCs , 8 devices based on PSFDTBT exhibited almost identical V oc , but higher J sc and much higher FF. As shown in Table 1 , the optimized devices based on P1 showed a PCE of 3.1% with a V oc of 0.97 V , a J sc of 6.7 mA / cm^2 , and an FF = 0.47. It is well - known that the processing solvent can dramatically affect the morphology of blend film and thus the photovoltaic performance of devices. When the solvent was changed from DCB to TCB , the photovoltaic performance could be further improved. As shown in Table 1 , when the active layer was PSFDTBT / PC71BM in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , the highest PCE of 4.6% with a V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm , and an FF of 0.60 was achieved. J-V curves of polymer solar cells fabricated with different weight ratio of PSFDTBT : PC71BM in TCB solutions are shown in Figure 3b. It is worth noting that such performance was achieved from simply fabricated devices without using any additive , posttreatment , or extra layers , which is beneficial for preparation of low cost polymer solar cells. To verify the accuracy of the J sc measurement results , external quantum efficiencies ( EQEs ) of solar cells were measured under illumination of monochromatic light. As shown in Figure 4 , solar cells , which were fabricated from PSFDTBT : PC71BM in a ratio of 1 : 3.5 ( w / w ) in DCB solutions and PSFDTBT : PC71BM in a ratio of 1 : 3 ( w / w ) in TCB solutions , both exhibited a broad photoresponse extending from 350 to 700 nm. Especially , the device based on a ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM of 1 : 3 ( w / w ) in TCB solutions exhibited the maximum EQE of 72% at 479 nm. The J sc calculated from integration of the EQE with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum roughly agreed with the J sc obtained from the J-V measurements. To understand the relationship between device performances and active layer morphology , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) measurements were conducted to investigate the surface morphology of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDTBT: This is a "Material Name" entity. It is a type of polymer used in the solar cells.
2. PC71BM: This is another "Material Name" entity. It is a fullerene derivative used in the solar cells.
3. DCB: This is a "Material Name" entity. It stands for dichlorobenzene, a solvent used in the processing of the solar cells.
4. TCB: This is a "Material Name" entity. It stands for 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene, another solvent used in the processing of the solar cells.

These are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PSFDTBT
2. PC71BM
3. DCB
4. TCB

These are the entities that clearly refer to Material Names in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| DCB |
| TCB |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The performance of PSCs was insensitive to the ratio of donor to acceptor in range of 1 : 2.5 to 1 : 4. With a weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM is 1 : 3.5 , a PCE of 4.2% with a V oc of 0.96 V , a J sc of 7.6 mA / cm^2 , and an FF of 0.56 was achieved under illumination from an AM 1.5G solar simulator ( 100 mW cm^-2 ). Such high V oc of almost 1 V is consistent with the low - lying HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT. In comparison with the device performance of P1 based PSCs , 8 devices based on PSFDTBT exhibited almost identical V oc , but higher J sc and much higher FF. As shown in Table 1 , the optimized devices based on P1 showed a PCE of 3.1% with a V oc of 0.97 V , a J sc of 6.7 mA / cm^2 , and an FF = 0.47. It is well - known that the processing solvent can dramatically affect the morphology of blend film and thus the photovoltaic performance of devices. When the solvent was changed from DCB to TCB , the photovoltaic performance could be further improved. As shown in Table 1 , when the active layer was PSFDTBT / PC71BM in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , the highest PCE of 4.6% with a V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm , and an FF of 0.60 was achieved. J-V curves of polymer solar cells fabricated with different weight ratio of PSFDTBT : PC71BM in TCB solutions are shown in Figure 3b. It is worth noting that such performance was achieved from simply fabricated devices without using any additive , posttreatment , or extra layers , which is beneficial for preparation of low cost polymer solar cells. To verify the accuracy of the J sc measurement results , external quantum efficiencies ( EQEs ) of solar cells were measured under illumination of monochromatic light. As shown in Figure 4 , solar cells , which were fabricated from PSFDTBT : PC71BM in a ratio of 1 : 3.5 ( w / w ) in DCB solutions and PSFDTBT : PC71BM in a ratio of 1 : 3 ( w / w ) in TCB solutions , both exhibited a broad photoresponse extending from 350 to 700 nm. Especially , the device based on a ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM of 1 : 3 ( w / w ) in TCB solutions exhibited the maximum EQE of 72% at 479 nm. The J sc calculated from integration of the EQE with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum roughly agreed with the J sc obtained from the J-V measurements. To understand the relationship between device performances and active layer morphology , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) measurements were conducted to investigate the surface morphology of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSCs: This refers to polymer solar cells, which are the main subject of the paragraph.
2. PSFDTBT: This is a type of polymer material used in the solar cells.
3. PC71BM: This is another type of material used in the solar cells, often in combination with PSFDTBT.
4. DCB: This refers to dichlorobenzene, which is a processing solvent used in the fabrication of the solar cells.
5. TCB: This refers to 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene, another processing solvent used in the fabrication of the solar cells.
6. AM 1.5G solar simulator: This is a type of light source used to test the performance of the solar cells.
7. HOMO energy level: This is a property of the PSFDTBT material, referring to its highest occupied molecular orbital energy level.
8. PCE: This stands for power conversion efficiency, which is a key performance metric for solar cells.
9. Voc: This stands for open-circuit voltage, another important performance metric for solar cells.
10. Jsc: This stands for short-circuit current density, yet another key performance metric for solar cells.
11. FF: This stands for fill factor, a metric that reflects the quality of the solar cell's output voltage and current.
12. EQE: This stands for external quantum efficiency, a measure of the solar cell's ability to convert incident photons into electrical current.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PSFDTBT: This is a type of polymer material used in the solar cells, and its properties include:
 * Low-lying HOMO energy level
2. PC71BM: This is another type of material used in the solar cells, and its properties include:
 * Affecting the morphology of blend film
 * Affecting the photovoltaic performance of devices
3. DCB: This is a processing solvent used in the fabrication of the solar cells, and its properties include:
 * Affecting the morphology of blend film
 * Affecting the photovoltaic performance of devices
4. TCB: This is another processing solvent used in the fabrication of the solar cells, and its properties include:
 * Affecting the morphology of blend film
 * Affecting the photovoltaic performance of devices
5. AM 1.5G solar simulator: This is a type of light source used to test the performance of the solar cells, and its properties include:
 * Illumination intensity

Note: HOMO energy level, PCE, Voc, Jsc, and FF are properties of the solar cells, not just the materials themselves. They are important properties to consider when evaluating the performance of the solar cells, but they do not directly refer to the properties of the materials.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Low-lying HOMO energy level (of PSFDTBT) |
| Affecting the morphology of blend film (of PC71BM, DCB, TCB) |
| Affecting the photovoltaic performance of devices (of PC71BM, DCB, TCB) |
| Illumination intensity (of AM 1.5G solar simulator) |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The performance of PSCs was insensitive to the ratio of donor to acceptor in range of 1 : 2.5 to 1 : 4. With a weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM is 1 : 3.5 , a PCE of 4.2% with a V oc of 0.96 V , a J sc of 7.6 mA / cm^2 , and an FF of 0.56 was achieved under illumination from an AM 1.5G solar simulator ( 100 mW cm^-2 ). Such high V oc of almost 1 V is consistent with the low - lying HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT. In comparison with the device performance of P1 based PSCs , 8 devices based on PSFDTBT exhibited almost identical V oc , but higher J sc and much higher FF. As shown in Table 1 , the optimized devices based on P1 showed a PCE of 3.1% with a V oc of 0.97 V , a J sc of 6.7 mA / cm^2 , and an FF = 0.47. It is well - known that the processing solvent can dramatically affect the morphology of blend film and thus the photovoltaic performance of devices. When the solvent was changed from DCB to TCB , the photovoltaic performance could be further improved. As shown in Table 1 , when the active layer was PSFDTBT / PC71BM in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , the highest PCE of 4.6% with a V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm , and an FF of 0.60 was achieved. J-V curves of polymer solar cells fabricated with different weight ratio of PSFDTBT : PC71BM in TCB solutions are shown in Figure 3b. It is worth noting that such performance was achieved from simply fabricated devices without using any additive , posttreatment , or extra layers , which is beneficial for preparation of low cost polymer solar cells. To verify the accuracy of the J sc measurement results , external quantum efficiencies ( EQEs ) of solar cells were measured under illumination of monochromatic light. As shown in Figure 4 , solar cells , which were fabricated from PSFDTBT : PC71BM in a ratio of 1 : 3.5 ( w / w ) in DCB solutions and PSFDTBT : PC71BM in a ratio of 1 : 3 ( w / w ) in TCB solutions , both exhibited a broad photoresponse extending from 350 to 700 nm. Especially , the device based on a ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM of 1 : 3 ( w / w ) in TCB solutions exhibited the maximum EQE of 72% at 479 nm. The J sc calculated from integration of the EQE with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum roughly agreed with the J sc obtained from the J-V measurements. To understand the relationship between device performances and active layer morphology , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) measurements were conducted to investigate the surface morphology of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films.

Let's think step by step.

1. "a PCE of 4.2%" - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) of 4.2%
2. "a V oc of 0.96 V" - Open-Circuit Voltage (Voc) of 0.96 Volts
3. "a J sc of 7.6 mA / cm^2" - Short-Circuit Current Density (Jsc) of 7.6 milliamperes per square centimeter
4. "an FF of 0.56" - Fill Factor (FF) of 0.56
5. "a PCE of 3.1%" - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) of 3.1%
6. "a V oc of 0.97 V" - Open-Circuit Voltage (Voc) of 0.97 Volts
7. "a J sc of 6.7 mA / cm^2" - Short-Circuit Current Density (Jsc) of 6.7 milliamperes per square centimeter
8. "an FF = 0.47" - Fill Factor (FF) of 0.47
9. "a PCE of 4.6%" - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) of 4.6%
10. "a V oc of 0.94 V" - Open-Circuit Voltage (Voc) of 0.94 Volts
11. "a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm" - Short-Circuit Current Density (Jsc) of 8.0 milliamperes per square centimeter
12. "an FF of 0.60" - Fill Factor (FF) of 0.60
13. "The maximum EQE of 72%" - External Quantum Efficiency (EQE) of 72%

Note: The units for Jsc and EQE are given per square centimeter (cm^2) and percentage (%), respectively. The other properties do not have units as they are ratios or percentages.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. "4.2%" - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
2. "0.96 V" - Open-Circuit Voltage (Voc)
3. "7.6 mA / cm^2" - Short-Circuit Current Density (Jsc)
4. "0.56" - Fill Factor (FF)
5. "3.1%" - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
6. "0.97 V" - Open-Circuit Voltage (Voc)
7. "6.7 mA / cm^2" - Short-Circuit Current Density (Jsc)
8. "0.47" - Fill Factor (FF)
9. "4.6%" - Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)
10. "0.94 V" - Open-Circuit Voltage (Voc)
11. "8.0 mA / cm" - Short-Circuit Current Density (Jsc)
12. "0.60" - Fill Factor (FF)
13. "72%" - External Quantum Efficiency (EQE)
